metadata.title: CVE-2022-45420 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use tables inside of an iframe, an attacker could have caused iframecontents to be rendered outside the boundaries of the iframe, resulting inpotential user confusion or spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affectsFirefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
